title: How She Ra Gives Us Hope
author: Five by Five Takes
comment: I wasnt expecting to cry this morning

i'm gonna be totally honest.

when i started watching She-Ra, I expected it to be all childish happiness and love. Instead what I got was something deep, that went straight to the heart. As someone who had parents very similar to Shadow Weaver, I had to stop after watching season 1 because it hurt too much. but someone close to me told me about the fact that this show also helped them deal with their abuse and self-reflect on it. i'm so glad i stuck through with it to the end because it WAS worth it.
"Bow has parents" I laughed so hard at this line
“ confusing emotions for catra” that’s a subtitle for “ your gay adora”

“A forest isn’t beautiful because we command it to grow. A song doesn’t make us feel something because we know how it ends. Genuine connection isn’t a grasp for control, but a desire to share, and it’s those things we share that, I think, make life sweetest.” 
..”and maybe that’s magic”
description:
love often wins the day, but i've rarely seen it as well articulated *why* as she ra does in its final season. 

a billion thanks to everyone who read and watched drafts and watched me slowly go insane. enjoy what is probably too many uses of the word "love"

-sara

what did YOU like about she ra’s finale?


music: broken pieces - gavin luke, chasing cloud nine - LUCHS, threads - ebb and flod
